text: "Yes, at this my heart trembles, and is moved out of its place.

name: Job 37:2
text: Hear, oh, hear the noise of his voice, the sound that goes out of his mouth.

name: Job 37:3
text: He sends it forth under the whole sky, and his lightning to the ends of the earth.

name: Job 37:4
text: After it a voice roars. He thunders with the voice of his majesty. He doesn"t hold back anything when his voice is heard.

name: Job 37:5
text: God thunders marvelously with his voice. He does great things, which we can"t comprehend.

name: Job 37:6
text: For he says to the snow, "Fall on the earth;" likewise to the shower of rain, and to the showers of his mighty rain.

name: Job 37:7
text: He seals up the hand of every man, that all men whom he has made may know it.

name: Job 37:8
text: Then the animals take cover, and remain in their dens.

name: Job 37:9
text: Out of its room comes the storm, and cold out of the north.

name: Job 37:10
text: By the breath of God, ice is given, and the breadth of the waters is frozen.

name: Job 37:11
text: Yes, he loads the thick cloud with moisture. He spreads abroad the cloud of his lightning.

name: Job 37:12
text: It is turned around by his guidance, that they may do whatever he commands them on the surface of the habitable world,

name: Job 37:13
text: Whether it is for correction, or for his land, or for loving kindness, that he causes it to come.

name: Job 37:14
text: "Listen to this, Job. Stand still, and consider the wondrous works of God.

name: Job 37:15
text: Do you know how God controls them, and causes the lightning of his cloud to shine?

name: Job 37:16
text: Do you know the workings of the clouds, the wondrous works of him who is perfect in knowledge?

name: Job 37:17
text: You whose clothing is warm, when the earth is still by reason of the south wind?

name: Job 37:18
text: Can you, with him, spread out the sky, which is strong as a cast metal mirror?

name: Job 37:19
text: Teach us what we shall tell him, for we can"t make our case by reason of darkness.

name: Job 37:20
text: Shall it be told him that I would speak? Or should a man wish that he were swallowed up?

name: Job 37:21
text: Now men don"t see the light which is bright in the skies, but the wind passes, and clears them.

name: Job 37:22
text: Out of the north comes golden splendor. With God is awesome majesty.

name: Job 37:23
text: We can"t reach the Almighty. He is exalted in power. In justice and great righteousness, he will not oppress.

name: Job 37:24
text: Therefore men revere him. He doesn"t regard any who are wise of heart."

name: Job 38:1
text: Then Yahweh answered Job out of the whirlwind,

name: Job 38:2
text: "Who is this who darkens counsel by words without knowledge?

name: Job 38:3
text: Brace yourself like a man, for I will question you, then you answer me!

name: Job 38:4
text: "Where were you when I laid the foundations of the earth? Declare, if you have understanding.

name: Job 38:5
text: Who determined its measures, if you know? Or who stretched the line on it?

name: Job 38:6
text: Whereupon were its foundations fastened? Or who laid its cornerstone,

name: Job 38:7
text: when the morning stars sang together, and all the sons of God shouted for joy?

name: Job 38:8
text: "Or who shut up the sea with doors, when it broke forth from the womb,

name: Job 38:9
text: when I made clouds its garment, and wrapped it in thick darkness,

name: Job 38:10
text: marked out for it my bound, set bars and doors,

name: Job 38:11
text: and said, "Here you may come, but no further. Here your proud waves shall be stayed?"

name: Job 38:12
text: "Have you commanded the morning in your days, and caused the dawn to know its place;

name: Job 38:13
text: that it might take hold of the ends of the earth, and shake the wicked out of it?

name: Job 38:14
text: It is changed as clay under the seal, and stands forth as a garment.

name: Job 38:15
text: From the wicked, their light is withheld. The high arm is broken.

name: Job 38:16
text: "Have you entered into the springs of the sea? Or have you walked in the recesses of the deep?

name: Job 38:17
text: Have the gates of death been revealed to you? Or have you seen the gates of the shadow of death?

name: Job 38:18
text: Have you comprehended the earth in its breadth? Declare, if you know it all.

name: Job 38:19
text: "What is the way to the dwelling of light? As for darkness, where is its place,

name: Job 38:20
text: that you should take it to its bound, that you should discern the paths to its house?

name: Job 38:21
text: Surely you know, for you were born then, and the number of your days is great!

name: Job 38:22
text: Have you entered the treasuries of the snow, or have you seen the treasures of the hail,

name: Job 38:23
text: which I have reserved against the time of trouble, against the day of battle and war?

name: Job 38:24
text: By what way is the lightning distributed, or the east wind scattered on the earth?

name: Job 38:25
text: Who has cut a channel for the flood water, or the path for the thunderstorm;

name: Job 38:26
text: To cause it to rain on a land where no man is; on the wilderness, in which there is no man;

name: Job 38:27
text: to satisfy the waste and desolate ground, to cause the tender grass to spring forth?

name: Job 38:28
text: Does the rain have a father? Or who fathers the drops of dew?

name: Job 38:29
text: Out of whose womb came the ice? The gray frost of the sky, who has given birth to it?

name: Job 38:30
text: The waters become hard like stone, when the surface of the deep is frozen.

name: Job 38:31
text: "Can you bind the cluster of the Pleiades, or loosen the cords of Orion?

name: Job 38:32
text: Can you lead forth the constellations in their season? Or can you guide the Bear with her cubs?

name: Job 38:33
text: Do you know the laws of the heavens? Can you establish its dominion over the earth?

name: Job 38:34
text: "Can you lift up your voice to the clouds, That abundance of waters may cover you?

name: Job 38:35
text: Can you send forth lightnings, that they may go? Do they report to you, "Here we are?"

name: Job 38:36
text: Who has put wisdom in the inward parts? Or who has given understanding to the mind?

name: Job 38:37
text: Who can number the clouds by wisdom? Or who can pour out the bottles of the sky,

name: Job 38:38
text: when the dust runs into a mass, and the clods of earth stick together?

name: Job 38:39
text: "Can you hunt the prey for the lioness, or satisfy the appetite of the young lions,

name: Job 38:40
text: when they crouch in their dens, and lie in wait in the thicket?

name: Job 38:41
text: Who provides for the raven his prey, when his young ones cry to God, and wander for lack of food?

name: Job 39:1
text: "Do you know the time when the mountain goats give birth? Do you watch when the doe bears fawns?

name: Job 39:2
text: Can you number the months that they fulfill? Or do you know the time when they give birth?

name: Job 39:3
text: They bow themselves, they bring forth their young, they end their labor pains.

name: Job 39:4
text: Their young ones become strong. They grow up in the open field. They go forth, and don"t return again.

name: Job 39:5
text: "Who has set the wild donkey free? Or who has loosened the bonds of the swift donkey,

name: Job 39:6
text: Whose home I have made the wilderness, and the salt land his dwelling place?

name: Job 39:7
text: He scorns the tumult of the city, neither does he hear the shouting of the driver.

name: Job 39:8
text: The range of the mountains is his pasture, He searches after every green thing.

name: Job 39:9
text: "Will the wild ox be content to serve you? Or will he stay by your feeding trough?

name: Job 39:10
text: Can you hold the wild ox in the furrow with his harness? Or will he till the valleys after you?

name: Job 39:11
text: Will you trust him, because his strength is great? Or will you leave to him your labor?

name: Job 39:12
text: Will you confide in him, that he will bring home your seed, and gather the grain of your threshing floor?

name: Job 39:13
text: "The wings of the ostrich wave proudly; but are they the feathers and plumage of love?

name: Job 39:14
text: For she leaves her eggs on the earth, warms them in the dust,

name: Job 39:15
text: and forgets that the foot may crush them, or that the wild animal may trample them.

name: Job 39:16
text: She deals harshly with her young ones, as if they were not hers. Though her labor is in vain, she is without fear,

name: Job 39:17
text: because God has deprived her of wisdom, neither has he imparted to her understanding.

name: Job 39:18
text: When she lifts up herself on high, she scorns the horse and his rider.

name: Job 39:19
text: "Have you given the horse might? Have you clothed his neck with a quivering mane?

name: Job 39:20
text: Have you made him to leap as a locust? The glory of his snorting is awesome.

name: Job 39:21
text: He paws in the valley, and rejoices in his strength. He goes out to meet the armed men.

name: Job 39:22
text: He mocks at fear, and is not dismayed, neither does he turn back from the sword.

name: Job 39:23
text: The quiver rattles against him, the flashing spear and the javelin.

name: Job 39:24
text: He eats up the ground with fierceness and rage, neither does he stand still at the sound of the trumpet.

name: Job 39:25
text: As often as the trumpet sounds he snorts, "Aha!" He smells the battle afar off, the thunder of the captains, and the shouting.

name: Job 39:26
text: "Is it by your wisdom that the hawk soars, and stretches her wings toward the south?

name: Job 39:27
text: Is it at your command that the eagle mounts up, and makes his nest on high?

name: Job 39:28
text: On the cliff he dwells, and makes his home, on the point of the cliff, and the stronghold.

name: Job 39:29
text: From there he spies out the prey. His eyes see it afar off.

name: Job 39:30
text: His young ones also suck up blood. Where the slain are, there he is."

name: Job 40:1
text: Moreover Yahweh answered Job,

name: Job 40:2
text: "Shall he who argues contend with the Almighty? He who argues with God, let him answer it."

name: Job 40:3
text: Then Job answered Yahweh,

name: Job 40:4
text: "Behold, I am of small account. What shall I answer you? I lay my hand on my mouth.

name: Job 40:5
text: I have spoken once, and I will not answer; Yes, twice, but I will proceed no further."

name: Job 40:6
text: Then Yahweh answered Job out of the whirlwind,

name: Job 40:7
text: "Now brace yourself like a man. I will question you, and you will answer me.

name: Job 40:8
text: Will you even annul my judgment? Will you condemn me, that you may be justified?

name: Job 40:9
text: Or do you have an arm like God? Can you thunder with a voice like him?

name: Job 40:10
text: "Now deck yourself with excellency and dignity. Array yourself with honor and majesty.

name: Job 40:11
text: Pour out the fury of your anger. Look at everyone who is proud, and bring him low.

name: Job 40:12
text: Look at everyone who is proud, and humble him. Crush the wicked in their place.

name: Job 40:13
text: Hide them in the dust together. Bind their faces in the hidden place.

name: Job 40:14
text: Then I will also admit to you that your own right hand can save you.

name: Job 40:15
text: "See now, behemoth, which I made as well as you. He eats grass as an ox.

name: Job 40:16
text: Look now, his strength is in his thighs. His force is in the muscles of his belly.

name: Job 40:17
text: He moves his tail like a cedar. The sinews of his thighs are knit together.

name: Job 40:18
text: His bones are like tubes of brass. His limbs are like bars of iron.

name: Job 40:19
text: He is the chief of the ways of God. He who made him gives him his sword.

name: Job 40:20
text: Surely the mountains produce food for him, where all the animals of the field play.

name: Job 40:21
text: He lies under the lotus trees, in the covert of the reed, and the marsh.

name: Job 40:22
text: The lotuses cover him with their shade. The willows of the brook surround him.

name: Job 40:23
text: Behold, if a river overflows, he doesn"t tremble. He is confident, though the Jordan swells even to his mouth.

name: Job 40:24
text: Shall any take him when he is on the watch, or pierce through his nose with a snare?

name: Job 41:1
text: "Can you draw out Leviathan with a fishhook, or press down his tongue with a cord?

name: Job 41:2
text: Can you put a rope into his nose, or pierce his jaw through with a hook?

name: Job 41:3
text: Will he make many petitions to you, or will he speak soft words to you?

name: Job 41:4
text: Will he make a covenant with you, that you should take him for a servant forever?

name: Job 41:5
text: Will you play with him as with a bird? Or will you bind him for your girls?

name: Job 41:6
text: Will traders barter for him? Will they part him among the merchants?

name: Job 41:7
text: Can you fill his skin with barbed irons, or his head with fish spears?

name: Job 41:8
text: Lay your hand on him. Remember the battle, and do so no more.

name: Job 41:9
text: Behold, the hope of him is in vain. Won"t one be cast down even at the sight of him?

name: Job 41:10
text: None is so fierce that he dare stir him up. Who then is he who can stand before me?

name: Job 41:11
text: Who has first given to me, that I should repay him? Everything under the heavens is mine.

name: Job 41:12
text: "I will not keep silence concerning his limbs, nor his mighty strength, nor his goodly frame.

name: Job 41:13
text: Who can strip off his outer garment? Who shall come within his jaws?

name: Job 41:14
text: Who can open the doors of his face? Around his teeth is terror.

name: Job 41:15
text: Strong scales are his pride, shut up together with a close seal.

name: Job 41:16
text: One is so near to another, that no air can come between them.

name: Job 41:17
text: They are joined one to another. They stick together, so that they can"t be pulled apart.

name: Job 41:18
text: His sneezing flashes out light. His eyes are like the eyelids of the morning.

name: Job 41:19
text: Out of his mouth go burning torches. Sparks of fire leap forth.

name: Job 41:20
text: Out of his nostrils a smoke goes, as of a boiling pot over a fire of reeds.

name: Job 41:21
text: His breath kindles coals. A flame goes forth from his mouth.

name: Job 41:22
text: There is strength in his neck. Terror dances before him.

name: Job 41:23
text: The flakes of his flesh are joined together. They are firm on him. They can"t be moved.

name: Job 41:24
text: His heart is as firm as a stone, yes, firm as the lower millstone.

name: Job 41:25
text: When he raises himself up, the mighty are afraid. They retreat before his thrashing.

name: Job 41:26
text: If one attacks him with the sword, it can"t prevail; nor the spear, the dart, nor the pointed shaft.

name: Job 41:27
text: He counts iron as straw; and brass as rotten wood.

name: Job 41:28
text: The arrow can"t make him flee. Sling stones are like chaff to him.

name: Job 41:29
text: Clubs are counted as stubble. He laughs at the rushing of the javelin.

name: Job 41:30
text: His undersides are like sharp potsherds, leaving a trail in the mud like a threshing sledge.

name: Job 41:31
text: He makes the deep to boil like a pot. He makes the sea like a pot of ointment.

name: Job 41:32
text: He makes a path shine after him. One would think the deep had white hair.

name: Job 41:33
text: On earth there is not his equal, that is made without fear.

name: Job 41:34
text: He sees everything that is high. He is king over all the sons of pride."

name: Job 42:1
text: Then Job answered Yahweh,

name: Job 42:2
text: "I know that you can do all things, and that no purpose of yours can be restrained.

name: Job 42:3
text: You asked, "Who is this who hides counsel without knowledge?" therefore I have uttered that which I did not understand, things too wonderful for me, which I didn"t know.

name: Job 42:4
text: You said, "Listen, now, and I will speak; I will question you, and you will answer me."

name: Job 42:5
text: I had heard of you by the hearing of the ear, but now my eye sees you.

name: Job 42:6
text: Therefore I abhor myself, and repent in dust and ashes."

name: Job 42:7
text: It was so, that after Yahweh had spoken these words to Job, Yahweh said to Eliphaz the Temanite, "My wrath is kindled against you, and against your two friends; for you have not spoken of me the thing that is right, as my servant Job has.

name: Job 42:8
text: Now therefore, take to yourselves seven bulls and seven rams, and go to my servant Job, and offer up for yourselves a burnt offering; and my servant Job shall pray for you, for I will accept him, that I not deal with you according to your folly. For you have not spoken of me the thing that is right, as my servant Job has."

name: Job 42:9
text: So Eliphaz the Temanite and Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the Naamathite went, and did what Yahweh commanded them, and Yahweh accepted Job.

name: Job 42:10
text: Yahweh turned the captivity of Job, when he prayed for his friends. Yahweh gave Job twice as much as he had before.

name: Job 42:11
text: Then came there to him all his brothers, and all his sisters, and all those who had been of his acquaintance before, and ate bread with him in his house. They comforted him, and consoled him concerning all the evil that Yahweh had brought on him. Everyone also gave him a piece of money, and everyone a ring of gold.

name: Job 42:12
text: So Yahweh blessed the latter end of Job more than his beginning. He had fourteen thousand sheep, six thousand camels, one thousand yoke of oxen, and a thousand female donkeys.

name: Job 42:13
text: He had also seven sons and three daughters.

name: Job 42:14
text: He called the name of the first, Jemimah; and the name of the second, Keziah; and the name of the third, Keren Happuch.

name: Job 42:15
text: In all the land were no women found so beautiful as the daughters of Job. Their father gave them an inheritance among their brothers.

name: Job 42:16
text: After this Job lived one hundred forty years, and saw his sons, and his sons" sons, to four generations.

name: Job 42:17
text: So Job died, being old and full of days.

name: Psalm 1:1
text: Blessed is the man who doesn"t walk in the counsel of the wicked, nor stand in the way of sinners, nor sit in the seat of scoffers;

name: Psalm 1:2
text: but his delight is in Yahweh"s law. On his law he meditates day and night.

name: Psalm 1:3
text: He will be like a tree planted by the streams of water, that brings forth its fruit in its season, whose leaf also does not wither. Whatever he does shall prosper.

name: Psalm 1:4
text: The wicked are not so, but are like the chaff which the wind drives away.

name: Psalm 1:5
text: Therefore the wicked shall not stand in the judgment, nor sinners in the congregation of the righteous.

name: Psalm 1:6
text: For Yahweh knows the way of the righteous, but the way of the wicked shall perish.

name: Psalm 2:1
text: Why do the nations rage, and the peoples plot a vain thing?

name: Psalm 2:2
text: The kings of the earth take a stand, and the rulers take counsel together, against Yahweh, and against his Anointed, saying,

name: Psalm 2:3
text: "Let"s break their bonds apart, and cast their cords from us."

name: Psalm 2:4
text: He who sits in the heavens will laugh. The Lord will have them in derision.

name: Psalm 2:5
text: Then he will speak to them in his anger, and terrify them in his wrath:

name: Psalm 2:6
text: "Yet I have set my King on my holy hill of Zion."

name: Psalm 2:7
text: I will tell of the decree. Yahweh said to me, "You are my son. Today I have become your father.

name: Psalm 2:8
text: Ask of me, and I will give the nations for your inheritance, the uttermost parts of the earth for your possession.

name: Psalm 2:9
text: You shall break them with a rod of iron. You shall dash them in pieces like a potter"s vessel."

name: Psalm 2:10
text: Now therefore be wise, you kings. Be instructed, you judges of the earth.

name: Psalm 2:11
text: Serve Yahweh with fear, and rejoice with trembling.

name: Psalm 2:12
text: Give sincere homage to the Son, lest he be angry, and you perish in the way, for his wrath will soon be kindled. Blessed are all those who take refuge in him.

name: Psalm 3:1
text: A Psalm by David, when he fled from Absalom his son. Yahweh, how my adversaries have increased! Many are those who rise up against me.

name: Psalm 3:2
text: Many there are who say of my soul, "There is no help for him in God." Selah.

name: Psalm 3:3
text: But you, Yahweh, are a shield around me, my glory, and the one who lifts up my head.

name: Psalm 3:4
text: I cry to Yahweh with my voice, and he answers me out of his holy hill. Selah.

name: Psalm 3:5
text: I laid myself down and slept. I awakened; for Yahweh sustains me.

name: Psalm 3:6
text: I will not be afraid of tens of thousands of people who have set themselves against me on every side.

name: Psalm 3:7
text: Arise, Yahweh! Save me, my God! For you have struck all of my enemies on the cheek bone. You have broken the teeth of the wicked.

name: Psalm 3:8
text: Salvation belongs to Yahweh. Your blessing be on your people. Selah.

name: Psalm 4:1
text: For the Chief Musician; on stringed instruments. A Psalm by David. Answer me when I call, God of my righteousness. Give me relief from my distress. Have mercy on me, and hear my prayer.

name: Psalm 4:2
text: You sons of men, how long shall my glory be turned into dishonor? Will you love vanity, and seek after falsehood? Selah.

name: Psalm 4:3
text: But know that Yahweh has set apart for himself him who is godly: Yahweh will hear when I call to him.

name: Psalm 4:4
text: Stand in awe, and don"t sin. Search your own heart on your bed, and be still. Selah.

name: Psalm 4:5
text: Offer the sacrifices of righteousness. Put your trust in Yahweh.

name: Psalm 4:6
text: Many say, "Who will show us any good?" Yahweh, let the light of your face shine on us.

name: Psalm 4:7
text: You have put gladness in my heart, more than when their grain and their new wine are increased.

name: Psalm 4:8
text: In peace I will both lay myself down and sleep, for you, Yahweh alone, make me live in safety.

name: Psalm 5:1
text: For the Chief Musician, with the flutes. A Psalm by David. Give ear to my words, Yahweh. Consider my meditation.

name: Psalm 5:2
text: Listen to the voice of my cry, my King and my God; for to you do I pray.

name: Psalm 5:3
text: Yahweh, in the morning you shall hear my voice. In the morning I will lay my requests before you, and will watch expectantly.

name: Psalm 5:4
text: For you are not a God who has pleasure in wickedness. Evil can"t live with you.

name: Psalm 5:5
text: The arrogant shall not stand in your sight. You hate all workers of iniquity.

name: Psalm 5:6
text: You will destroy those who speak lies. Yahweh abhors the bloodthirsty and deceitful man.

name: Psalm 5:7
text: But as for me, in the abundance of your loving kindness I will come into your house. I will bow toward your holy temple in reverence of you.

name: Psalm 5:8
text: Lead me, Yahweh, in your righteousness because of my enemies. Make your way straight before my face.

name: Psalm 5:9
text: For there is no faithfulness in their mouth. Their heart is destruction. Their throat is an open tomb. They flatter with their tongue.

name: Psalm 5:10
text: Hold them guilty, God. Let them fall by their own counsels; Thrust them out in the multitude of their transgressions, for they have rebelled against you.

name: Psalm 5:11
text: But let all those who take refuge in you rejoice, Let them always shout for joy, because you defend them. Let them also who love your name be joyful in you.

name: Psalm 5:12
text: For you will bless the righteous. Yahweh, you will surround him with favor as with a shield.

name: Psalm 6:1
text: For the Chief Musician; on stringed instruments, upon the eight-stringed lyre. A Psalm by David. Yahweh, don"t rebuke me in your anger, neither discipline me in your wrath.

name: Psalm 6:2
text: Have mercy on me, Yahweh, for I am faint. Yahweh, heal me, for my bones are troubled.

name: Psalm 6:3
text: My soul is also in great anguish. But you, Yahweh"how long?

name: Psalm 6:4
text: Return, Yahweh. Deliver my soul, and save me for your loving kindness" sake.

name: Psalm 6:5
text: For in death there is no memory of you. In Sheol, who shall give you thanks?

name: Psalm 6:6
text: I am weary with my groaning. Every night I flood my bed. I drench my couch with my tears.

name: Psalm 6:7
text: My eye wastes away because of grief. It grows old because of all my adversaries.

name: Psalm 6:8
text: Depart from me, all you workers of iniquity, for Yahweh has heard the voice of my weeping.

name: Psalm 6:9
text: Yahweh has heard my supplication. Yahweh accepts my prayer.

name: Psalm 6:10
text: May all my enemies be ashamed and dismayed. They shall turn back, they shall be disgraced suddenly.

name: Psalm 7:1
text: A meditation by David, which he sang to Yahweh, concerning the words of Cush, the Benjamite. Yahweh, my God, I take refuge in you. Save me from all those who pursue me, and deliver me,

name: Psalm 7:2
text: lest they tear apart my soul like a lion, ripping it in pieces, while there is none to deliver.

name: Psalm 7:3
text: Yahweh, my God, if I have done this, if there is iniquity in my hands,

name: Psalm 7:4
text: if I have rewarded evil to him who was at peace with me (yes, if I have delivered him who without cause was my adversary),

name: Psalm 7:5
text: let the enemy pursue my soul, and overtake it; yes, let him tread my life down to the earth, and lay my glory in the dust. Selah.

name: Psalm 7:6
text: Arise, Yahweh, in your anger. Lift up yourself against the rage of my adversaries. Awake for me. You have commanded judgment.

name: Psalm 7:7
text: Let the congregation of the peoples surround you. Rule over them on high.

name: Psalm 7:8
text: Yahweh administers judgment to the peoples. Judge me, Yahweh, according to my righteousness, and to my integrity that is in me.

name: Psalm 7:9
text: Oh let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end, but establish the righteous; their minds and hearts are searched by the righteous God.

name: Psalm 7:10
text: My shield is with God, who saves the upright in heart.

name: Psalm 7:11
text: God is a righteous judge, yes, a God who has indignation every day.

name: Psalm 7:12
text: If a man doesn"t relent, he will sharpen his sword; he has bent and strung his bow.

name: Psalm 7:13
text: He has also prepared for himself the instruments of death. He makes ready his flaming arrows.

name: Psalm 7:14
text: Behold, he travails with iniquity. Yes, he has conceived mischief, and brought forth falsehood.

name: Psalm 7:15
text: He has dug a hole, and has fallen into the pit which he made.

name: Psalm 7:16
text: The trouble he causes shall return to his own head. His violence shall come down on the crown of his own head.

name: Psalm 7:17
text: I will give thanks to Yahweh according to his righteousness, and will sing praise to the name of Yahweh Most High.
